Allegation On an unknown date, Staff 1 was supposed to be watching Youth
A and Youth B. Staff 1 allowed Youth B to "suck Youth A's dick."
The incident occurred at the Grand Rapids YMCA.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/6/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
having very little information on the allegations involving Youth B
and Youth D at the Y-center. She also reported Youth D struggles
with relationships with older men and she is refusing to be
interviewed.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/6/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A denied
witnessing or knowledge of a sexual encounter between Youth B
and Youth D taking place at the Y-center or any other location. He
reported Staff 1 is the staff who primarily takes youth to the Y-
center. Youth A reported Youth B and Youth D will “wrestle around
like “normal teenagers” and they appear to treat each other like a
“brother and sister”.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/6/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B denied
any inappropriate behaviors between himself and Youth D. He
reported going to the Y-center several times with Youth D and
never being out of sight from staff during these outings. Staff will
follow youth into the locker room and staff engage in the activities
with the youth. There is always a male and female staff present if
there are female and male youth going on the outing. Youth B
reported his relationship with Youth D began prior to placement
because they both attended the same school and became friends.
They will wrestle but not out of anger more like brother and sister.
Staff always tell them to stop and try to get between them. Youth
B reported there is nothing more in his relationship with Youth D.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/6/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C
2

reported being told about Staff 1 letting Youth B get “head” from
Youth D while at the Y-center by Youth A. Youth C believed Youth
A said this because Youth A wanted to go to the park rather than
the Y-center again. Youth C reported this “getting head” must
have happened in the family bathroom because that is the one
place youth can go together and sometimes staff don’t pay
attention. Staff 1 can be busy playing basketball and we can go
wherever we want to go as long as we return to the basketball
court. Everyone heard Youth A report this, but no one saw
anything.
Youth D refused to be interviewed at the facility on 2/6/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at home on 2/8/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. He denied the allegations of
Youth D giving “head’ to Youth B at the Y-center. He believes this
never could have occurred and never heard that it did happen. He
reported always providing line of site supervision to the youth
during an outing and if a female youth going to the restroom, Staff
1 will stand outside the door until she comes out. When he was at
the Y-center with Youth B and Youth D, he played basketball with
Youth B the whole time while Youth D sat on the bench and
watched them play.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/8/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
when staff take youth to the Y-center the ratio is to be 1:1 and
staff are to keep the youth in line of site at all times. They will use
the family bathroom when swimming, but line of site must be in
place for supervision. Supervisor 1 also reported having no
concerns about staff’s supervision during Y-center outing. She has
observed Youth B and Youth D’s interactions and believes they
are friends who attend the same school. If Youth B and Youth D
engage in horseplay, staff are to stand between them while telling
them to stop the activity. Providing redirection in a positive manner
and if they don’t stop staff are to call for support from another
staff.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/8/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported not being told
about the allegations between Youth B and Youth D at the Y-
center. He reported the similar supervision requirements when
staff take youth on an outing. If youth are going swimming, then
the staff will leave the facility wearing their swimsuit, so they don’t
have to change and can keep the appropriate level of supervision.

Staff 7 reported Youth B and Youth D will horseplay on the unit
and staff will attempt to redirect and get between them. Staff 7

inappropriately and he got between them and had them stop.
They were punching each other in their private areas while

Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/8/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She had no
information on the allegations at the Y-center because she doesn’t
take youth on outing because of her position as supervisor. She
reported Youth B and Youth D will engage in fake boxing and
horseplay but are redirected by staff and staff will get between
them if they don’t stop.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/8/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He had no
knowledge of the allegations involving the Y-center but did report
knowing that Youth B and Youth D will engage in horseplay to
which staff verbally deescalate. He did not report any
inappropriate touching between Youth B and Youth D.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/13/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being at the
Y-center with Staff 1, Youth B and Youth D. Staff 1 and Youth B
played basketball while Staff 6 and Youth D sat on the side of the
hot tub. She also reported no concerns about Youth B and Youth
D during the outing. Staff 6 reported a belief that Youth B has a
crush on Youth D because Youth B has changed since Youth D
came into the program. Youth B will “show off” in front of Youth D
and argue with Youth A about Youth D. Staff 6 has no knowledge
of sexual activity between Youth B and Youth D and when they
begin play fighting staff intervene as reported by other staff
interviewed.
Complainant/Supervisor 4 was interviewed via phone on
2/21/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being informed of the allegations from Youth C when they were
discussing issues about the unit. Youth C told Complainant in
passing and just injected the statement “Youth D gave Youth B
“head” at the Y-center” in the middle of their conversation. She
reported having no further information about the situation.
Complainant reported one staff can take three youth on an outing
and will be within the required ratio of 1 staff to 3 youth. She
reported best practice is to send as many staff as possible, so the
facility tries to send at least 2 staff if possible. Complainant
4

reported having no concerns about the interaction with Youth B
and Youth D in the unit, but reported Youth B and Youth D will
horseplay. Staff will redirect Youth B and Youth D in an effort to
have them stop the horseplay. Complainant reported Youth D has
not reported any inappropriate behaviors.
Documents Reviewed:
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed.
Documentation indicates Staff 1 was hired in November 2023 and
terminated on 2/4/2024 for misconduct.
D.A. Blodgett St. John’s Program Procedure Youth
Supervision Procedure dated 7/2023. This document outlines
the supervision requirements involved in providing appropriate
supervision to youth. When an activity involves more than one
youth, staff must closely monitor the youth by staying in close
physical proximity and positioning self to be able to observe all
participants engaging in the activity. During an off-campus activity
if a staff of a different gender is accompanying a youth and the
youth needs to use the changing room or bathroom, the staff is to
allow only one youth in the room at a time and staff are to remain
in close proximity and maintain visual contact of the door leading
to the bathroom or changing room.
Activities off-campus approval list covering 12/1/23 to
1/31/24. This document outlines approved outings for youth during
the month of December and January. Two outings to the Y-center
occurred during this time frame involving Staff 1 taking youth to
the Y-center. The first outing occurred on 1/4/24 and involved
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D happening from 4:30 to 7:00 pm.
The second outing to the Y-center occurred on 1/5/24 and
involved Youth A, Youth B, and Youth D from 4:30 to 6:00 pm.
This second outing also involved another staff member.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation there is no
evidence that supports Staff 1 did not provide the appropriate
supervision to youth during an outing to the Y-center and there is
no clear evidence that Youth B and Youth D engaged in oral sex.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
5

licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
